017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles;
020import java.lang.invoke.MethodHandles.Lookup;
021import java.lang.invoke.VarHandle;
022
023import java.util.ArrayDeque;
024import java.util.ArrayList;
025import java.util.Collection;
026import java.util.Collections;
027import java.util.HashSet;
028import java.util.Iterator;
029import java.util.List;
030import java.util.Objects;
031import java.util.Queue;
032
033import java.util.function.Function;
034import java.util.function.Predicate;
035
036import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
037import org.microbean.development.annotation.EntryPoint;
038import org.microbean.development.annotation.Experimental;
039import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingDiscouraged;
040import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingEncouraged;
041
042/**
043 * A value-like object representing a (Java-like) type for purposes of
044 * testing assignability.
045 *
046 * <p>Concisely: {@link Type}s represent {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
047 * java.lang.reflect.Type}s (or other frameworks' similar
048 * representations) without any dependence on {@link
049 * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type} itself.</p>
050 *
051 * <p>This class is used directly primarily by the {@link Semantics}
052 * class and its subclasses.</p>
053 *
054 * @param <T> the type of the thing representing a Java type that is
055 * being adapted; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
056 * java.lang.reflect.Type} or some other framework's representation of
057 * one
058 *
059 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
060 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
061 *
062 * @see Semantics
063 */
064@Experimental
065public abstract class Type<T> implements Owner<T> {
066
067
068  /*
069   * Static fields.
070   */
071
072
073  private static final VarHandle SUPERTYPES;
074
075  static {
076    final Lookup lookup = MethodHandles.lookup();
077    try {
078      SUPERTYPES = lookup.findVarHandle(Type.class, "supertypes", List.class);
079    } catch (final NoSuchFieldException | IllegalAccessException reflectiveOperationException) {
080      throw (Error)new ExceptionInInitializerError(reflectiveOperationException.getMessage()).initCause(reflectiveOperationException);
081    }
082  }
083
084
085  /*
086   * Instance fields.
087   */
088
089
090  private final T type;
091
092  private volatile List<? extends Type<T>> supertypes;
093
094
095  /*
096   * Constructors.
097   */
098
099
100  /**
101   * Creates a new {@link Type}.
102   *
103   * @param type the type to represent; must not be {@code null}
104   *
105   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}
106   */
107  protected Type(final T type) {
108    super();
109    this.type = Objects.requireNonNull(type, "type");
110  }
111
112  /**
113   * Creates a new {@link Type} that models custom supertypes.
114   *
115   * <p>Among other things, this means that the {@link #object()}
116   * method will return {@code null}.</p>
117   *
118   * @param supertypes the custom supertypes; must not be {@code null}
119   *
120   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code supertypes} is {@code
121   * null}
122   */
123  protected Type(final List<? extends Type<T>> supertypes) {
124    super();
125    this.type = null;
126    this.supertypes = List.copyOf(supertypes);
127  }
128
129
130  /*
131   * Instance methods.
132   */
133
134
135  /**
136   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
137   * a Java type that has a name.
138   *
139   * <p>In the Java reflective type system, only {@link Class} and
140   * {@link java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable} instances have names.</p>
141   *
142   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
143   * a Java type that has a name
144   *
145   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
146   * and deterministic.
147   *
148   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
149   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
150   *
151   * @see #name()
152   *
153   * @see Class#getName()
154   *
155   * @see java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable#getName()
156   */
157  @Override // Owner<T>
158  @OverridingEncouraged
159  public boolean named() {
160    return Owner.super.named();
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Returns the name of this {@link Type} if it has one <strong>or
165   * {@code null} if it does not</strong>.
166   *
167   * <p>Only classes (and interfaces) and type variables in the Java
168   * reflective type system have names.</p>
169   *
170   * @return the name of this {@link Type}, or {@code null}
171   *
172   * @nullability Implementations of this method may, and often will,
173   * return {@code null}.
174   *
175   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
176   * and deterministic.
177   *
178   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
179   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
180   */
181  @Override // Owner<T>
182  public abstract String name();
183
184  /**
185   * Returns the object supplied at construction time that is the type
186   * this {@link Type} is representing, or {@code null} if this
187   * information is not available, or if this {@link Type} {@linkplain
188   * #customSupertyped() represents a collection of custom
189   * supertypes}.
190   *
191   * @return the object supplied at construction time that is the type
192   * this {@link Type} is representing
193   *
194   * @nullability This method may return {@code null}.
195   *
196   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
197   *
198   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
199   * threads.
200   */
201  @Override // Owner<T>
202  public final T object() {
203    return this.type;
204  }
205
206  /**
207   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
208   * the uppermost reference type in the type system.
209   *
210   * <p>In all practical cases, if an implementation of this method
211   * returns {@code true}, it means this {@link Type} represents
212   * {@link Object Object.class}.</p>
213   *
214   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
215   * meet these requirements.</p>
216   *
217   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
218   * the uppermost reference type in the type system, e.g. {@link
219   * Object Object.class}
220   *
221   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
222   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
223   *
224   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
225   * and deterministic.
226   */
227  public abstract boolean top();
228
229  /**
230   * Returns a (possibly cached) {@link List} of this {@link Type}'s
231   * <em>direct supertypes</em>, defined to be its immediate
232   * superclass or supertype, if any, and any interfaces it directly
233   * implements.
234   *
235   * @return a (possibly cached) {@link List} of this {@link Type}'s
236   * direct supertypes
237   *
238   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
239   *
240   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
241   *
242   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
243   * threads.
244   *
245   * @see #computeDirectSupertypes()
246   */
247  public final List<? extends Type<T>> directSupertypes() {
248    return List.copyOf(this.computeDirectSupertypes());
249  }
250
251  /**
252   * Returns an {@linkplain
253   * Collections#unmodifiableList(List) unmodifiable and
254   * immutable <code>List</code>} of the <em>direct
255   * supertypes</em> of this {@link Type}, or an {@linkplain
256   * List#isEmpty() empty <code>List</code>} if there are
257   * no direct supertypes, or if this {@link Type} implementation does
258   * not distinguish between direct and non-direct supertypes.
259   *
260   * <p>The direct supertypes of a type are defined to be those
261   * analogous to those described by the <a
262   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10.2"
263   * target="_parent">Java Language Specification, section 4.10.2</a>,
264   * minus any types featuring wildcards.</p>
265   *
266   * <p>The {@link List} returned must not contain {@code this}
267   * and must have no {@code null} or duplicate elements.</p>
268   *
269   * <p>The ordering within the returned {@link List} is not
270   * specified, <strong>but must be deterministic between
271   * invocations</strong>.</p>
272   *
273   * <p>The size of the {@link List} returned must not change
274   * between calls.</p>
275   *
276   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
277   * meet these requirements.</p>
278   *
279   * <p><strong>The default implementation of this method returns an
280   * empty {@link List}.</strong> Many subclasses may wish to
281   * override this behavior.</p>
282   *
283   * @return an {@linkplain
284   * Collections#unmodifiableList(List) unmodifiable and
285   * immutable <code>List</code>} of the <em>direct
286   * supertypes</em> of this {@link Type}; never {@code null}
287   *
288   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
289   * return {@code null}.
290   *
291   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
292   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
293   *
294   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
295   * idempotent and deterministic.
296   *
297   * @see JavaTypes#directSupertypes(java.lang.reflect.Type)
298   *
299   * @see #directSupertypes()
300   *
301   * @see #supertypes()
302   *
303   * @see #computeSupertypes()
304   */
305  protected List<? extends Type<T>> computeDirectSupertypes() {
306    return List.of();
307  }
308
309  /**
310   * If this {@link Type} represents a parameterized type or a generic
311   * array type, returns a {@link Type} representing its raw type or
312   * generic component type, or, if this {@link Type} does not
313   * represent a parameterized type or a generic array type, returns
314   * {@code this}.
315   *
316   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
317   * meet these requirements.</p>
318   *
319   * @return a suitable {@link Type}; never {@code null}; often {@code
320   * this}
321   *
322   * @nullability Overrides of this method must not return {@code
323   * null}.
324   *
325   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
326   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
327   *
328   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent and
329   * deterministic.
330   */
331  @Override // Owner<T>
332  public abstract Type<T> type();
333
334  /**
335   * Returns the owner of this {@link Type} as an {@link Owner
336   * Owner&lt;T&gt;}, suitable only for equality comparisons, or
337   * {@code null} if this {@link Type} is not owned.
338   *
339   * @return the owner of this {@link Type}, or {@code null}
340   *
341   * @nullability Overrides of this method must not return
342   * {@code null}.
343   *
344   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
345   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
346   *
347   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent
348   * and deterministic.
349   */
350  @Override // Owner<T>
351  public abstract Owner<T> owner();
352
353  /**
354   * Returns a {@link Type}, <strong>usually new</strong>, whose
355   * {@link #object() object()} method will return the supplied {@code
356   * object}.
357   *
358   * @param object the modeled type; must not be {@code null}
359   *
360   * @return a {@link Type}
361   *
362   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code object} is {@code null}
363   *
364   * @nullability Overrides of this method must not return {@code
365   * null}.
366   *
367   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be deterministic but
368   * not idempotent.
369   *
370   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
371   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
372   */
373  public abstract Type<T> withObject(final T object);
374
375  /**
376   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
377   * a generic class by virtue of having type parameters.
378   *
379   * <p>This implementation calls {@link Owner#hasTypeParameters()}
380   * and returns the result. Subclasses are encouraged to provide a
381   * faster implementation.</p>
382   *
383   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
384   * a generic class by virtue of having type parameters
385   *
386   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
387   * idempotent and deterministic.
388   *
389   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
390   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
391   *
392   * @see Owner#hasTypeParameters()
393   *
394   * @see #typeParameters()
395   */
396  @Override // Owner<T>
397  @OverridingEncouraged
398  public boolean hasTypeParameters() {
399    return Owner.super.hasTypeParameters();
400  }
401
402  /**
403   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
404   * a parameterized type by virtue of having type arguments.
405   *
406   * <p>This implementation calls the {@link #typeArguments()} method
407   * and returns {@code true} if the resulting {@link List}
408   * {@linkplain List#isEmpty() is not empty}.  Subclasses are
409   * encouraged to provide a faster implementation.</p>
410   *
411   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
412   * a parameterized type by virtue of having type arguments
413   *
414   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
415   * idempotent and deterministic.
416   *
417   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
418   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
419   *
420   * @see #typeArguments()
421   */
422  @OverridingEncouraged
423  public boolean hasTypeArguments() {
424    final Collection<?> tas = this.typeArguments();
425    return tas != null && !tas.isEmpty();
426  }
427
428  /**
429   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
430   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
431   * parameters.
432   *
433   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
434   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a generic
435   * class.</p>
436   *
437   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
438   * meet these requirements.</p>
439   *
440   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
441   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
442   * parameters; never {@code null}
443   *
444   * @nullability Overrides of this method must not return
445   * {@code null}.
446   *
447   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
448   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
449   *
450   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent
451   * and deterministic.
452   */
453  @Override // Owner<T>
454  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> typeParameters();
455
456  /**
457   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
458   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
459   * arguments.
460   *
461   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
462   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
463   * parameterized type.</p>
464   *
465   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
466   * meet these requirements.</p>
467   *
468   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
469   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
470   * parameters; never {@code null}
471   *
472   * @nullability Overrides of this method must not return
473   * {@code null}.
474   *
475   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
476   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
477   *
478   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent
479   * and deterministic.
480   */
481  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> typeArguments();
482
483  /**
484   * Returns {@code false} when invoked since {@link Type}s don't have
485   * parameters (unlike {@link Owner}s representing {@link
486   * java.lang.reflect.Executable executables}).
487   *
488   * @return {@code false} when invoked
489   *
490   * @nullability This method always returns {@code null}.
491   *
492   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
493   *
494   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
495   * threads.
496   */
497  @Override // Owner<T>
498  public final boolean hasParameters() {
499    return false;
500  }
501
502  /**
503   * Returns {@code null} when invoked since {@link Type}s don't have
504   * parameters (unlike {@link Owner}s representing {@link
505   * java.lang.reflect.Executable executables}).
506   *
507   * @return {@code null} when invoked
508   *
509   * @nullability This method always returns {@code null}.
510   *
511   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
512   *
513   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
514   * threads.
515   */
516  @Override // Owner<T>
517  public final List<? extends Type<T>> parameters() {
518    return null;
519  }
520
521  /**
522   * Returns the <em>component type</em> of this {@link Type}, if
523   * there is one, <strong>or {@code null} if there is not</strong>.
524   *
525   * <p>Overrides of this method must return a non-{@code null}
526   * result only when this {@link Type} represents a type that is
527   * either an array or a generic array type.</p>
528   *
529   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
530   * meet these requirements.</p>
531   *
532   * @return the <em>component type</em> of this {@link Type}, if
533   * there is one, or {@code null} if there is not
534   *
535   * @nullability Overrides of this method may return {@code
536   * null}.
537   *
538   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
539   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
540   *
541   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent
542   * and deterministic.
543   */
544  public abstract Type<T> componentType();
545
546  /**
547   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
548   * either a type variable or a wildcard type.
549   *
550   * <p>This implementation calls the {@link #upperBounds()} method
551   * and returns {@code true} if the resulting {@link List}
552   * {@linkplain List#isEmpty() is not empty}.  Subclasses are
553   * encouraged to provide a faster implementation.</p>
554   *
555   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an override does not
556   * meet these requirements.</p>
557   *
558   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
559   * either a type variable or a wildcard type
560   *
561   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
562   * idempotent and deterministic.
563   *
564   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
565   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
566   *
567   * @see #upperBounds()
568   */
569  @OverridingEncouraged
570  public boolean upperBounded() {
571    return !this.upperBounds().isEmpty();
572  }
573
574  /**
575   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
576   * a wildcard type with a lower bound.
577   *
578   * <p>This implementation calls the {@link #lowerBounds()} method
579   * and returns {@code true} if the resulting {@link List}
580   * {@linkplain List#isEmpty() is not empty}.  Subclasses are
581   * encouraged to provide a faster implementation.</p>
582   *
583   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an override does not
584   * meet these requirements.</p>
585   *
586   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
587   * a wildcard type with lower bounds
588   *
589   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
590   * idempotent and deterministic.
591   *
592   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
593   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
594   *
595   * @see #lowerBounds()
596   */
597  @OverridingEncouraged
598  public boolean lowerBounded() {
599    return !this.lowerBounds().isEmpty();
600  }
601
602  /**
603   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
604   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s lower
605   * bounds.
606   *
607   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
608   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
609   * lower-bounded wildcard type.</p>
610   *
611   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
612   * meet these requirements.</p>
613   *
614   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
615   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s lower
616   * bounds; never {@code null}; often {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
617   * empty}
618   *
619   * @nullability Overrides of this method must not return
620   * {@code null}.
621   *
622   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
623   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
624   *
625   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent
626   * and deterministic.
627   */
628  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> lowerBounds();
629
630  /**
631   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
632   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s upper
633   * bounds.
634   *
635   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
636   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models either a type
637   * variable, an unbounded wildcard type, or an upper-bounded
638   * wildcard type.
639   *
640   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
641   * meet these requirements.</p>
642   *
643   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
644   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s upper
645   * bounds; never {@code null}; often {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
646   * empty}
647   *
648   * @nullability Overrides of this method must not return
649   * {@code null}.
650   *
651   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
652   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
653   *
654   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent
655   * and deterministic.
656   */
657  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> upperBounds();
658
659  /**
660   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
661   * custom {@linkplain #supertypes() list of supertypes} and nothing
662   * else.
663   *
664   * <p>This method returns {@code true} when and only when all of the
665   * following conditions are met:</p>
666   *
667   * <ul>
668   *
669   * <li>The {@link #object()} method returns {@code null}</li>
670   *
671   * <li>The {@link #hasTypeArguments()} method returns {@code
672   * false}</li>
673   *
674   * <li>The {@link #arrayType()} method returns {@code false}</li>
675   *
676   * <li>The {@link #lowerBounded()} method returns {@code false}</li>
677   *
678   * <li>The {@link #upperBounded()} method returns {@code false}</li>
679   *
680   * <li>The {@link #named()} method returns {@code false}</li>
681   *
682   * </ul>
683   *
684   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link type} models a
685   * custom {@linkplain #supertypes() list of supertypes} and nothing
686   * else
687   *
688   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
689   *
690   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
691   * threads.
692   *
693   * @see #supertypes()
694   *
695   * @see #Type(List)
696   */
697  public final boolean customSupertyped() {
698    return
699      this.object() == null &&
700      !this.named() &&
701      !this.hasTypeArguments() &&
702      !this.arrayType() &&
703      !this.lowerBounded() &&
704      !this.upperBounded();
705  }
706  
707  /**
708   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
709   * class or interface.
710   *
711   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
712   * #named()} returns {@code true} and {@link #upperBounded()}
713   * returns {@code false}.</p>
714   *
715   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
716   * class
717   *
718   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
719   *
720   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
721   * threads.
722   *
723   * @see #named()
724   *
725   * @see #upperBounded()
726   */
727  public final boolean classOrInterface() {
728    return this.named() && !this.upperBounded();
729  }
730
731  /**
732   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models an
733   * array type (which may be a {@linkplain #genericArrayType()
734   * generic array type}).
735   *
736   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
737   * #componentType()} returns a non-{@code null} value.</p>
738   *
739   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models an
740   * array type (which may be a {@linkplain #genericArrayType()
741   * generic array type})
742   *
743   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
744   *
745   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
746   * threads.
747   *
748   * @see #componentType()
749   */
750  public final boolean arrayType() {
751    return this.componentType() != null;
752  }
753
754  /**
755   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
756   * generic array type.
757   *
758   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
759   * #componentType()} returns a non-{@code null} value and {@link
760   * #type()} returns a {@link Type} that is not {@code this}.</p>
761   *
762   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
763   * generic array type
764   *
765   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
766   *
767   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
768   * threads.
769   *
770   * @see #componentType()
771   *
772   * @see #type()
773   */
774  public final boolean genericArrayType() {
775    return this.componentType() != null && this.type() != this;
776  }
777
778  /**
779   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
780   * non-generic array type.
781   *
782   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
783   * #componentType()} returns a non-{@code null} value and {@link
784   * #type()} returns a {@link Type} that is {@code this}.</p>
785   *
786   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
787   * non-generic array type
788   *
789   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
790   *
791   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
792   * threads.
793   *
794   * @see #componentType()
795   *
796   * @see #type()
797   */
798  public final boolean nonGenericArrayType() {
799    return this.componentType() != null && this.type() == this;
800  }
801
802  /**
803   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
804   * parameterized type.
805   *
806   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
807   * #hasTypeArguments()} returns {@code true}.</p>
808   *
809   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
810   * parameterized type
811   *
812   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
813   *
814   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
815   * threads.
816   *
817   * @see #hasTypeArguments()
818   */
819  public final boolean parameterizedType() {
820    return this.hasTypeArguments();
821  }
822
823  /**
824   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
825   * type variable.
826   *
827   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
828   * #named()} returns {@code true} and {@link #upperBounded()}
829   * returns {@code true}.</p>
830   *
831   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
832   * type variable
833   *
834   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
835   *
836   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
837   * threads.
838   *
839   * @see #named()
840   *
841   * @see #upperBounded()
842   */
843  public final boolean typeVariable() {
844    return this.named() && this.upperBounded();
845  }
846
847  /**
848   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
849   * wildcard type.
850   *
851   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
852   * #named()} returns {@code true} and one of {@link #upperBounded()}
853   * or {@link #lowerBounded()} returns {@code true}.</p>
854   *
855   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
856   * wildcard type
857   *
858   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
859   *
860   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
861   * threads.
862   *
863   * @see #named()
864   *
865   * @see #upperBounded()
866   *
867   * @see #lowerBounded()
868   */
869  public final boolean wildcard() {
870    return !this.named() && (this.upperBounded() || this.lowerBounded());
871  }
872
873  /**
874   * Returns all the supertypes of this {@link Type} (which normally
875   * includes this {@link Type}).
876   *
877   * <p>This method returns a cached list of supertypes, or, if
878   * such a list does not yet exist, returns the result of
879   * invoking the {@link #computeSupertypes()} method.</p>
880   *
881   * @return an {@linkplain
882   * Collections#unmodifiableList(List) unmodifiable
883   * <code>List</code>} containing all the supertypes of this
884   * {@link Type} (which normally includes this {@link Type}); never
885   * {@code null}; never {@linkplain Collection#isEmpty() empty}
886   *
887   * @exception IllegalStateException if the return value of an
888   * invocation of {@link #computeSupertypes()} is {@linkplain
889   * Collection#isEmpty() empty}
890   *
891   * @nullability This method does not return {@code null}.
892   *
893   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
894   *
895   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
896   * threads.
897   *
898   * @see #computeSupertypes()
899   */
900  public final List<? extends Type<T>> supertypes() {
901    List<? extends Type<T>> c = this.supertypes; // volatile read
902    if (c == null) {
903      c = List.copyOf(this.computeSupertypes());
904      if (c.isEmpty()) {
905        throw new IllegalStateException();
906      }
907      if (!SUPERTYPES.compareAndSet(this, null, c)) { // volatile write
908        return this.supertypes; // volatile read
909      }
910    }
911    return c;
912  }
913
914  /**
915   * Returns all the supertypes of this {@link Type} (which normally
916   * includes this {@link Type}).
917   *
918   * <p>The returned {@link List} must not be {@code null} and
919   * must not be {@linkplain Collection#isEmpty() empty}.  Undefined
920   * behavior will result if overrides do not adhere to this
921   * requirement.</p>
922   *
923   * <p>The order of elements within the {@link List} returned
924   * by any invocation of this method must be deterministic.
925   * Undefined behavior will result if overrides do not adhere to this
926   * requirement.</p>
927   *
928   * <p>The default implementation of this method reflexively and
929   * transitively applies the direct supertype relation (represented
930   * by the {@link #directSupertypes()} method) to this {@link Type}
931   * and returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
932   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} containing the result.</p>
933   *
934   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
935   * unmodifiable <code>Collection</code>} containing all the
936   * supertypes of this {@link Type} (which includes this {@link
937   * Type}); never {@code null}; never {@linkplain
938   * Collection#isEmpty() empty}
939   *
940   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
941   * return {@code null}.
942   *
943   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
944   * idempotent and deterministic.
945   *
946   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
947   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
948   *
949   * @see #supertypes()
950   *
951   * @see #directSupertypes()
952   *
953   * @see #computeDirectSupertypes()
954   */
955  protected List<? extends Type<T>> computeSupertypes() {
956    return computeSupertypesBreadthFirst(this);
957  }
958
959  /**
960   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} is a
961   * supertype of the supplied {@link Type}.
962   *
963   * <p>This method uses a combination of the {@link #supertypes()}
964   * method and the {@link #equals(Type, Type)} method in its
965   * implementation.</p>
966   *
967   * @param sub the purported subtype; must not be {@code null}
968   *
969   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} is a
970   * supertype of the supplied {@link Type}
971   *
972   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code sub} is {@code null}
973   *
974   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
975   *
976   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
977   * threads.
978   *
979   * @see #supertypes()
980   *
981   * @see #equals(Type, Type)
982   */
983  @Convenience
984  public final boolean supertypeOf(final Type<?> sub) {
985    // Does this represent a supertype of sub?  Remember that the
986    // supertype relation is reflexive.
987    for (final Type<?> supertype : sub.supertypes()) {
988      if (equals(supertype, this)) {
989        return true;
990      }
991    }
992    return false;
993  }
994
995  /**
996   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} is a
997   * subtype of the supplied {@link Type}.
998   *
999   * <p>This method uses a combination of the {@link #supertypes()}
1000   * method and the {@link #equals(Type, Type)} method in its
1001   * implementation.</p>
1002   *
1003   * @param sup the purported supertype; must not be {@code null}
1004   *
1005   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} is a
1006   * subtype of the supplied {@link Type}
1007   *
1008   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code sup} is {@code null}
1009   *
1010   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1011   *
1012   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1013   * threads.
1014   *
1015   * @see #supertypes()
1016   *
1017   * @see #equals(Type, Type)
1018   */
1019  @Convenience
1020  public final boolean subtypeOf(final Type<?> sup) {
1021    for (final Type<?> supertype : this.supertypes()) {
1022      if (equals(sup, supertype)) {
1023        return true;
1024      }
1025    }
1026    return false;
1027  }
1028
1029  @Override // Object
1030  public int hashCode() {
1031    return hashCode(this);
1032  }
1033  
1034  @Override // Owner
1035  public boolean equals(final Object other) {
1036    if (other == this) {
1037      return true;
1038    } else if (other instanceof Type<?> type) { // instanceof is deliberate
1039      return equals(this, type);
1040    } else {
1041      return false;
1042    }
1043  }
1044
1045
1046  /*
1047   * Static methods.
1048   */
1049
1050
1051  /**
1052   * Returns a hashcode for the supplied {@link Type}, independent of
1053   * its particular implementation of the {@link Object#hashCode()}
1054   * method.
1055   *
1056   * @param type the {@link Type}; may be {@code null}
1057   *
1058   * @return a hashcode for the supplied {@link Type}
1059   *
1060   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1061   *
1062   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1063   * threads.
1064   *
1065   * @see #equals(Type, Type)
1066   */
1067  public static final int hashCode(final Type<?> type) {
1068    if (type == null) {
1069      return 0;
1070    }
1071
1072    int hashCode = 1;
1073
1074    final List<? extends Type<?>> typeArguments = type.typeArguments();
1075    if (typeArguments == null || typeArguments.isEmpty()) {
1076      hashCode = 31 * hashCode;
1077    } else {
1078      for (final Type<?> arg : typeArguments) {
1079        hashCode = 31 * hashCode + hashCode(arg);
1080      }
1081    }
1082
1083    final Type<?> componentType = type.componentType();
1084    hashCode = 31 * hashCode + (componentType == null ? 0 : hashCode(componentType));
1085
1086    final List<? extends Type<?>> lowerBounds = type.lowerBounds();
1087    if (lowerBounds == null || lowerBounds.isEmpty()) {
1088      hashCode = 31 * hashCode;
1089    } else {
1090      for (final Type<?> b : lowerBounds) {
1091        hashCode = 31 * hashCode + hashCode(b);
1092      }
1093    }
1094
1095    final List<? extends Type<?>> upperBounds = type.upperBounds();
1096    if (upperBounds == null || upperBounds.isEmpty()) {
1097      hashCode = 31 * hashCode;
1098    } else {
1099      for (final Type<?> b : upperBounds) {
1100        hashCode = 31 * hashCode + hashCode(b);
1101      }
1102    }
1103
1104    final String name = type.name();
1105    if (name == null) {
1106      if (typeArguments == null && componentType == null && lowerBounds == null && upperBounds == null) {
1107        // Just a supertype container
1108        final List<? extends Type<?>> supertypes = type.supertypes();
1109        if (supertypes == null) {
1110          hashCode = 31 * hashCode;
1111        } else {
1112          for (final Type<?> supertype : supertypes) {
1113            hashCode = 31 * hashCode + hashCode(supertype);
1114          }
1115        }
1116      } else {
1117        hashCode = 31 * hashCode;
1118      }
1119    } else {
1120      hashCode = 31 * hashCode + name.hashCode();
1121    }
1122
1123    final Type<?> typeType = type.type();
1124    if (typeType != type) {
1125      hashCode = 31 * hashCode + (typeType == null ? 0 : hashCode(typeType));
1126    }
1127
1128    final Owner<?> owner = type.owner();
1129    if (owner == null) {
1130      hashCode = 31 * hashCode;
1131    } else if (owner instanceof Type<?> ownerType) {
1132      hashCode = 31 * hashCode + hashCode(ownerType);
1133    } else {
1134      for (final Type<?> p : owner.parameters()) {
1135        hashCode = 31 * hashCode + hashCode(p);
1136      }
1137      hashCode = 31 * hashCode + hashCode(owner.type()); // return type
1138      hashCode = 31 * hashCode + hashCode((Type<?>)owner.owner()); // declaring class
1139    }
1140
1141    return hashCode;
1142  }
1143
1144  /**
1145   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the two supplied {@link
1146   * Type}s are equal, based solely upon the properties publicly
1147   * exposed by the {@link Type} class.
1148   *
1149   * @param t1 the first {@link Type}; may be {@code null}
1150   *
1151   * @param t2 the second {@link Type}; may be {@code null}
1152   *
1153   * @return {@code true} if and only if the two supplied {@link
1154   * Type}s are equal, based solely upon the properties publicly
1155   * exposed by the {@link Type} abstract class
1156   *
1157   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1158   *
1159   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1160   * threads.
1161   *
1162   * @see #hashCode(Type)
1163   */
1164  public static final boolean equals(final Type<?> t1, final Type<?> t2) {
1165    if (t1 == t2) {
1166      return true;
1167    } else if (t1 == null || t2 == null) {
1168      return false;
1169    }
1170
1171    final Object t1Object = t1.object();
1172    if (t1Object == null) {
1173      if (t2.object() != null) {
1174        return false;
1175      }
1176    } else {
1177      return t1.objectEquals(t2.object());
1178    }
1179
1180    if (t1.hasTypeArguments()) {
1181      if (!t2.hasTypeArguments()) {
1182        return false;
1183      }
1184      return parameterizedTypeEqualsParameterizedType(t1, t2);
1185    } else if (t2.hasTypeArguments()) {
1186      return false;
1187    }
1188
1189    final Type<?> t1ComponentType = t1.componentType();
1190    final Type<?> t2ComponentType = t2.componentType();
1191    if (t1ComponentType == null) {
1192      if (t2ComponentType != null) {
1193        return false;
1194      } else if (t1.lowerBounded()) {
1195        return lowerBoundedWildcardTypeEqualsType(t1, t2);
1196      } else if (t1.upperBounded()) {
1197        return upperBoundedTypeEqualsType(t1, t2);
1198      } else if (t2.lowerBounded() || t2.upperBounded()) {
1199        return false;
1200      }
1201
1202      // Not parameterized type.
1203      // Not array type.
1204      // Not generic array type.
1205      // Not type variable.
1206      // Not wildcard.
1207      final String t1Name = t1.name();
1208      final String t2Name = t2.name();
1209      if (t1Name == null) {
1210        // The only way this can happen is if t1 is actually just a
1211        // placeholder for its supertypes.
1212        if (t2Name != null) {
1213          return false;
1214        }
1215        return supertypesEqual(t1, t2);
1216      } else {
1217        return
1218          t1Name.equals(t2Name) &&
1219          equals((Type<?>)t1.owner(), (Type<?>)t2.owner());
1220      }
1221    } else if (!equals(t1ComponentType, t2ComponentType)) {
1222      return false;
1223    }
1224
1225    // Non-null component types are equal; these are arrays
1226    final Type<?> t1Type = t1.type();
1227    final Type<?> t2Type = t2.type();
1228    if (t1Type == t1) {
1229      return t2Type == t2;
1230    } else if (t2Type == t2) {
1231      return false;
1232    }
1233    // Generic array types.
1234    return equals(t1Type, t2Type);
1235  }
1236
1237  private static final boolean supertypesEqual(final Type<?> t1, final Type<?> t2) {
1238    if (t1 == t2) {
1239      return true;
1240    } else if (t1 == null || t2 == null) {
1241      return false;
1242    }
1243    final List<? extends Type<?>> s1 = t1.supertypes();
1244    final List<? extends Type<?>> s2 = t2.supertypes();
1245    final int size = s1.size();
1246    if (s2.size() != size) {
1247      return false;
1248    }
1249    for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
1250      final Type<?> supertype1 = s1.get(i);
1251      if (supertype1 != s1 && supertype1 != s2) {
1252        final Type<?> supertype2 = s2.get(i);
1253        if (supertype2 != t1 && supertype2 != t2 && !equals(supertype1, supertype2)) {
1254          return false;
1255        }
1256      }
1257    }
1258    return true;
1259  }
1260
1261  private static final boolean parameterizedTypeEqualsParameterizedType(final Type<?> t1, final Type<?> t2) {
1262    assert t1 != t2;
1263    assert t1.hasTypeArguments();
1264    assert t2.hasTypeArguments();
1265
1266    final List<? extends Type<?>> t1Args = t1.typeArguments();
1267    final List<? extends Type<?>> t2Args = t2.typeArguments();
1268    int size = t1Args.size();
1269    if (t2Args.size() != size) {
1270      return false;
1271    }
1272    for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
1273      if (!equals(t1Args.get(i), t2Args.get(i))) {
1274        return false;
1275      }
1276    }
1277    assert t1.type() != t1;
1278    assert t2.type() != t2;
1279    return equals(t1.type(), t2.type());
1280  }
1281
1282  private static final boolean lowerBoundedWildcardTypeEqualsType(final Type<?> t1, final Type<?> t2) {
1283    assert t1 != t2;
1284    assert t1.lowerBounded();
1285
1286    final List<? extends Type<?>> t1LowerBounds = t1.lowerBounds();
1287    final List<? extends Type<?>> t2LowerBounds = t2.lowerBounds();
1288    final int size = t1LowerBounds.size();
1289    if (t2LowerBounds.size() != size) {
1290      return false;
1291    }
1292    for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
1293      if (!equals(t1LowerBounds.get(i), t2LowerBounds.get(i))) {
1294        return false;
1295      }
1296    }
1297    return true;
1298  }
1299
1300  private static final boolean upperBoundedTypeEqualsType(final Type<?> t1, final Type<?> t2) {
1301    assert t1 != t2;
1302    assert t1.upperBounded();
1303
1304    if (!t2.upperBounded()) {
1305      return false;
1306    }
1307
1308    final String t1Name = t1.name();
1309    if (!Objects.equals(t1Name, t2.name())) {
1310      return false;
1311    }
1312
1313    final List<? extends Type<?>> t1UpperBounds = t1.upperBounds();
1314    final List<? extends Type<?>> t2UpperBounds = t2.upperBounds();
1315    final int size = t1UpperBounds.size();
1316    if (t2UpperBounds.size() != size) {
1317      return false;
1318    }
1319    for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
1320      if (!equals(t1UpperBounds.get(i), t2UpperBounds.get(i))) {
1321        return false;
1322      }
1323    }
1324
1325    if (t1Name != null) {
1326      // Two identically-named but not identical type variables.
1327      final Owner<?> t1Owner = t1.owner();
1328      final Owner<?> t2Owner = t2.owner();
1329      if (t1Owner == null || t2Owner == null) {
1330        // Type variables have to be declared by *some* owner, whether
1331        // it be a class or an executable.
1332        throw new IllegalArgumentException();
1333      } else if (t1Owner instanceof Type<?> t1OwnerType) {
1334        return t2Owner instanceof Type<?> t2OwnerType && equals(t1OwnerType, t2OwnerType);
1335      } else {
1336        return executableEqualsExecutable(t1Owner, t2Owner);
1337      }
1338    }
1339
1340    // Two upper bounded (nameless) wildcards with the same bounds;
1341    // they're equal.
1342    return true;
1343  }
1344
1345  private static final boolean executableEqualsExecutable(final Owner<?> o1, final Owner<?> o2) {
1346    assert o1 != o2;
1347    assert o1.hasTypeParameters();
1348    assert o2.hasTypeParameters();
1349    assert o1.named();
1350    assert o2.named();
1351    assert o1.hasParameters();
1352    assert o2.hasParameters();
1353    assert !(o1 instanceof Type);
1354    assert !(o2 instanceof Type);
1355
1356    if (!Objects.equals(o1.name(), o2.name())) {
1357      return false;
1358    }
1359    final List<? extends Type<?>> o1Parameters = o1.parameters();
1360    final List<? extends Type<?>> o2Parameters = o2.parameters();
1361    final int size = o1Parameters.size();
1362    if (o2Parameters.size() != size) {
1363      return false;
1364    }
1365    for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
1366      if (!equals(o1Parameters.get(i), o2Parameters.get(i))) {
1367        return false;
1368      }
1369    }
1370    return
1371      !equals(o1.type(), o2.type()) ||
1372      !equals((Type<?>)o1.owner(), (Type<?>)o2.owner());
1373  }
1374
1375  /**
1376   * A utility method that maps the supplied {@link Collection} into
1377   * an unmodifiable {@link List} using the supplied mapping
1378   * function.
1379   *
1380   * @param <T> the type of the incoming elements
1381   *
1382   * @param <U> the type of the returned {@link Collection}'s elements
1383   *
1384   * @param c the incoming {@link Collection}; may be {@code null}
1385   *
1386   * @param f the mapping {@link Function}
1387   *
1388   * @return an unmodifiable mapped {@link List}
1389   *
1390   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1391   *
1392   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1393   *
1394   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1395   * threads.  It does not synchronize on the supplied {@link
1396   * Collection} when iterating over it.
1397   */
1398  static final <T, U> List<U> map(final Collection<? extends T> c, final Function<? super T, ? extends U> f) {
1399    if (c == null || c.isEmpty()) {
1400      return List.of();
1401    }
1402    final Iterator<? extends T> i = c.iterator();
1403    switch (c.size()) {
1404    case 0:
1405      throw new AssertionError();
1406    case 1:
1407      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()));
1408    case 2:
1409      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1410                     f.apply(i.next()));
1411    case 3:
1412      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1413                     f.apply(i.next()),
1414                     f.apply(i.next()));
1415    case 4:
1416      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1417                     f.apply(i.next()),
1418                     f.apply(i.next()),
1419                     f.apply(i.next()));
1420    case 5:
1421      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1422                     f.apply(i.next()),
1423                     f.apply(i.next()),
1424                     f.apply(i.next()),
1425                     f.apply(i.next()));
1426    case 6:
1427      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1428                     f.apply(i.next()),
1429                     f.apply(i.next()),
1430                     f.apply(i.next()),
1431                     f.apply(i.next()),
1432                     f.apply(i.next()));
1433    case 7:
1434      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1435                     f.apply(i.next()),
1436                     f.apply(i.next()),
1437                     f.apply(i.next()),
1438                     f.apply(i.next()),
1439                     f.apply(i.next()),
1440                     f.apply(i.next()));
1441    case 8:
1442      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1443                     f.apply(i.next()),
1444                     f.apply(i.next()),
1445                     f.apply(i.next()),
1446                     f.apply(i.next()),
1447                     f.apply(i.next()),
1448                     f.apply(i.next()),
1449                     f.apply(i.next()));
1450    case 9:
1451      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1452                     f.apply(i.next()),
1453                     f.apply(i.next()),
1454                     f.apply(i.next()),
1455                     f.apply(i.next()),
1456                     f.apply(i.next()),
1457                     f.apply(i.next()),
1458                     f.apply(i.next()),
1459                     f.apply(i.next()));
1460    case 10:
1461      return List.of(f.apply(i.next()),
1462                     f.apply(i.next()),
1463                     f.apply(i.next()),
1464                     f.apply(i.next()),
1465                     f.apply(i.next()),
1466                     f.apply(i.next()),
1467                     f.apply(i.next()),
1468                     f.apply(i.next()),
1469                     f.apply(i.next()),
1470                     f.apply(i.next()));
1471    default:
1472      final List<U> rv = new ArrayList<>(c.size());
1473      while (i.hasNext()) {
1474        rv.add(f.apply(i.next()));
1475      }
1476      return Collections.unmodifiableList(rv);
1477    }
1478  }
1479
1480  /**
1481   * A utility method that maps the supplied array into an
1482   * unmodifiable {@link List} using the supplied mapping function.
1483   *
1484   * @param <T> the type of the incoming elements
1485   *
1486   * @param <U> the type of the returned {@link List}'s elements
1487   *
1488   * @param c the incoming array; may be {@code null}
1489   *
1490   * @param f the mapping {@link Function}
1491   *
1492   * @return an unmodifiable mapped {@link List}
1493   *
1494   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
1495   *
1496   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
1497   *
1498   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
1499   * threads.  It does not synchronize on the supplied array when
1500   * accessing its elements.
1501   */
1502  static final <T, U> List<U> map(final T[] c, final Function<? super T, ? extends U> f) {
1503    if (c == null) {
1504      return List.of();
1505    }
1506    switch (c.length) {
1507    case 0:
1508      return List.of();
1509    case 1:
1510      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]));
1511    case 2:
1512      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1513                     f.apply(c[1]));
1514    case 3:
1515      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1516                     f.apply(c[1]),
1517                     f.apply(c[2]));
1518    case 4:
1519      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1520                     f.apply(c[1]),
1521                     f.apply(c[2]),
1522                     f.apply(c[3]));
1523    case 5:
1524      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1525                     f.apply(c[1]),
1526                     f.apply(c[2]),
1527                     f.apply(c[3]),
1528                     f.apply(c[4]));
1529    case 6:
1530      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1531                     f.apply(c[1]),
1532                     f.apply(c[2]),
1533                     f.apply(c[3]),
1534                     f.apply(c[4]),
1535                     f.apply(c[5]));
1536    case 7:
1537      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1538                     f.apply(c[1]),
1539                     f.apply(c[2]),
1540                     f.apply(c[3]),
1541                     f.apply(c[4]),
1542                     f.apply(c[5]),
1543                     f.apply(c[6]));
1544    case 8:
1545      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1546                     f.apply(c[1]),
1547                     f.apply(c[2]),
1548                     f.apply(c[3]),
1549                     f.apply(c[4]),
1550                     f.apply(c[5]),
1551                     f.apply(c[6]),
1552                     f.apply(c[7]));
1553    case 9:
1554      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1555                     f.apply(c[1]),
1556                     f.apply(c[2]),
1557                     f.apply(c[3]),
1558                     f.apply(c[4]),
1559                     f.apply(c[5]),
1560                     f.apply(c[6]),
1561                     f.apply(c[7]),
1562                     f.apply(c[8]));
1563    case 10:
1564      return List.of(f.apply(c[0]),
1565                     f.apply(c[1]),
1566                     f.apply(c[2]),
1567                     f.apply(c[3]),
1568                     f.apply(c[4]),
1569                     f.apply(c[5]),
1570                     f.apply(c[6]),
1571                     f.apply(c[7]),
1572                     f.apply(c[8]),
1573                     f.apply(c[9]));
1574    default:
1575      final List<U> rv = new ArrayList<>(c.length);
1576      for (int i = 0; i < c.length; i++) {
1577        rv.add(f.apply(c[i]));
1578      }
1579      return Collections.unmodifiableList(rv);
1580    }
1581  }
1582
1583  private static final <X> List<? extends Type<X>> computeSupertypesBreadthFirst(final Type<X> type) {
1584    final ArrayList<Type<X>> supertypes = new ArrayList<>(16);
1585    final Queue<Type<X>> q = new ArrayDeque<>(8);
1586    q.add(type);
1587    while (!q.isEmpty()) {
1588      final Type<X> head = q.remove();
1589      supertypes.add(head);
1590      q.addAll(head.directSupertypes());
1591    }
1592    supertypes.trimToSize();
1593    return Collections.unmodifiableList(supertypes);
1594  }
1595
1596
1597  /*
1598   * Inner and nested classes.
1599   */
1600
1601
1602  /**
1603   * An abstract embodiment of {@link Type} {@linkplain
1604   * #assignable(Type, Type) assignability rules}.
1605   *
1606   * <p>By default, no {@link Type} {@linkplain #assignable(Type,
1607   * Type) is assignable} to any other {@link Type} except itself.
1608   * Subclasses will obviously want to override this behavior in some,
1609   * if not all, cases.</p>
1610   *
1611   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
1612   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
1613   *
1614   * @see VariantSemantics
1615   *
1616   * @see InvariantSemantics
1617   *
1618   * @see CovariantSemantics
1619   *
1620   * @see CdiSemantics
1621   */
1622  @Experimental
1623  public static abstract class Semantics {
1624
1625
1626    /*
1627     * Constructors.
1628     */
1629
1630
1631    /**
1632     * Creates a new {@link Semantics}.
1633     */
1634    protected Semantics() {
1635      super();
1636    }
1637
1638
1639    /*
1640     * Instance methods.
1641     */
1642
1643
1644    /**
1645     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1646     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
1647     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1648     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1649     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using no autoboxing.
1650     *
1651     * <p>This is a convenience method that {@linkplain
1652     * JavaType#of(java.lang.reflect.Type, boolean) creates
1653     * <code>JavaType</code>s} to represent the supplied {@link
1654     * java.lang.reflect.Type}s before calling the (canonical) {@link
1655     * #assignable(Type, Type)} method.</p>
1656     *
1657     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
1658     * not be {@code null}
1659     *
1660     * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
1661     * not be {@code null}
1662     *
1663     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1664     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
1665     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1666     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1667     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using no autoboxing;
1668     * {@code false} otherwise
1669     *
1670     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1671     * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
1672     *
1673     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1674     * idempotent and deterministic.
1675     *
1676     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1677     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1678     *
1679     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1680     *
1681     * @see JavaType#of(java.lang.reflect.Type, boolean)
1682     */
1683    @Convenience
1684    public boolean assignable(final java.lang.reflect.Type receiverType,
1685                              final java.lang.reflect.Type payloadType) {
1686      return this.assignable(receiverType, payloadType, false);
1687    }
1688
1689    /**
1690     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1691     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
1692     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1693     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1694     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using the specified
1695     * autoboxing semantics.
1696     *
1697     * <p>This is a convenience method that {@linkplain
1698     * JavaType#of(java.lang.reflect.Type, boolean) creates
1699     * <code>JavaType</code>s} to represent the supplied {@link
1700     * java.lang.reflect.Type}s before calling the (canonical) {@link
1701     * #assignable(Type, Type)} method.</p>
1702     *
1703     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
1704     * not be {@code null}
1705     *
1706     * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
1707     * not be {@code null}
1708     *
1709     * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
1710     *
1711     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1712     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
1713     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1714     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1715     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using the specified
1716     * autoboxing semantics; {@code false} otherwise
1717     *
1718     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1719     * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
1720     *
1721     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1722     * idempotent and deterministic.
1723     *
1724     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1725     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1726     *
1727     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1728     *
1729     * @see JavaType#of(java.lang.reflect.Type, boolean)
1730     */
1731    @Convenience
1732    public boolean assignable(final java.lang.reflect.Type receiverType,
1733                              final java.lang.reflect.Type payloadType,
1734                              final boolean box) {
1735      return this.assignable(JavaType.of(receiverType, box), JavaType.of(payloadType, box));
1736    }
1737
1738    /**
1739     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1740     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1741     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1742     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1743     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance.
1744     *
1745     * <p>No autoboxing of types takes place.</p>
1746     *
1747     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
1748     * not be {@code null}
1749     *
1750     * @param payloadTypes the payload types as described above; must
1751     * not be {@code null}
1752     *
1753     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1754     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1755     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1756     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1757     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance;
1758     * {@code false} otherwise
1759     *
1760     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1761     * or {@code payloadTypes} is {@code null}
1762     *
1763     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1764     * idempotent and deterministic.
1765     *
1766     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1767     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1768     *
1769     * @see #anyAssignable(java.lang.reflect.Type, Collection,
1770     * boolean)
1771     */
1772    @Convenience
1773    public final boolean anyAssignable(final java.lang.reflect.Type receiverType,
1774                                       final Collection<? extends java.lang.reflect.Type> payloadTypes) {
1775      return this.anyAssignable(receiverType, payloadTypes, false);
1776    }
1777
1778    /**
1779     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1780     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1781     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1782     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1783     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance.
1784     *
1785     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
1786     * not be {@code null}
1787     *
1788     * @param payloadTypes the payload types as described above; must
1789     * not be {@code null}
1790     *
1791     * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
1792     *
1793     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1794     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1795     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1796     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1797     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance;
1798     * {@code false} otherwise
1799     *
1800     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1801     * or {@code payloadTypes} is {@code null}
1802     *
1803     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1804     * idempotent and deterministic.
1805     *
1806     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1807     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1808     */
1809    @Convenience
1810    public final boolean anyAssignable(final java.lang.reflect.Type receiverType,
1811                                       final Collection<? extends java.lang.reflect.Type> payloadTypes,
1812                                       final boolean box) {
1813      final JavaType receiverJavaType = JavaType.of(receiverType, box);
1814      for (final java.lang.reflect.Type payloadType : payloadTypes) {
1815        if (this.assignable(receiverJavaType, JavaType.of(payloadType, box))) {
1816          return true;
1817        }
1818      }
1819      return false;
1820    }
1821
1822    /**
1823     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1824     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1825     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1826     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1827     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance.
1828     *
1829     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1830     * receiverType}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1831     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1832     *
1833     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by a {@code payloadTypes}
1834     * element; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1835     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1836     *
1837     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
1838     * not be {@code null}
1839     *
1840     * @param payloadTypes the payload types as described above; must
1841     * not be {@code null}
1842     *
1843     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1844     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1845     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1846     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1847     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance;
1848     * {@code false} otherwise
1849     *
1850     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1851     * or {@code payloadTypes} is {@code null}
1852     *
1853     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1854     * idempotent and deterministic.
1855     *
1856     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1857     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1858     */
1859    @Convenience
1860    public final <X, Y> boolean anyAssignable(final Type<X> receiverType,
1861                                              final Collection<? extends Type<Y>> payloadTypes) {
1862      for (final Type<Y> payloadType : payloadTypes) {
1863        if (this.assignable(receiverType, payloadType)) {
1864          return true;
1865        }
1866      }
1867      return false;
1868    }
1869
1870    /**
1871     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1872     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
1873     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1874     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1875     * this {@link Semantics} instance.
1876     *
1877     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1878     * receiverType}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1879     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1880     *
1881     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadType};
1882     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1883     *
1884     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
1885     * not be {@code null}
1886     *
1887     * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
1888     * not be {@code null}
1889     *
1890     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1891     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
1892     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1893     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1894     * this {@link Semantics} instance; {@code false} otherwise
1895     *
1896     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1897     * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
1898     *
1899     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1900     * idempotent and deterministic.
1901     *
1902     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1903     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1904     */
1905    @EntryPoint
1906    @OverridingDiscouraged
1907    public <X, Y> boolean assignable(final Type<X> receiverType, final Type<Y> payloadType) {
1908      if (receiverType == Objects.requireNonNull(payloadType, "payloadType")) {
1909        return true;
1910      } else if (receiverType.hasTypeArguments()) {
1911        return parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromType(receiverType, payloadType);
1912      } else if (payloadType.hasTypeArguments()) {
1913        return this.nonParameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1914      } else if (receiverType.componentType() == null) {
1915        if (receiverType.lowerBounded()) {
1916          return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, true, payloadType);
1917        } else if (receiverType.upperBounded()) {
1918          if (receiverType.named()) {
1919            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1920          } else {
1921            return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, false, payloadType);
1922          }
1923        } else {
1924          return this.classIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1925        }
1926      } else if (receiverType.type() == receiverType) {
1927        return this.classIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1928      } else {
1929        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1930      }
1931    }
1932
1933    private final <X, Y> boolean nonParameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverNonParameterizedType,
1934                                                                                       final Type<Y> payloadParameterizedType) {
1935      if (receiverNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
1936        if (receiverNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
1937          return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, true /* lower bounded */, payloadParameterizedType);
1938        } else if (receiverNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
1939          if (receiverNonParameterizedType.named()) {
1940            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
1941          } else {
1942            return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, false /* upper bounded */, payloadParameterizedType);
1943          }
1944        } else {
1945          return this.classIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
1946        }
1947      } else if (receiverNonParameterizedType.type() == receiverNonParameterizedType) {
1948        return this.classIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
1949      } else {
1950        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
1951      }
1952    }
1953
1954    private final <X, Y> boolean classIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverClass,
1955                                                                           final Type<Y> payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1956      if (payloadNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
1957        if (payloadNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
1958          return this.classIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType, true);
1959        } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
1960          if (payloadNonParameterizedType.named()) {
1961            return this.classIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1962          } else {
1963            return this.classIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType, false);
1964          }
1965        } else {
1966          return this.classIsAssignableFromClass(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1967        }
1968      } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.type() == payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1969        return this.classIsAssignableFromClass(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1970      } else {
1971        return this.classIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1972      }
1973    }
1974
1975    /**
1976     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1977     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadClass} is assignable
1978     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1979     * receiverClass}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1980     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and only if {@code
1981     * payloadClass} models a {@linkplain Class Java class} and not
1982     * any other type, and if and only if {@code receiverClass} models
1983     * a {@linkplain Class Java class} and not any other type.
1984     *
1985     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1986     * method.</p>
1987     *
1988     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1989     *

1998     * not be {@code null}

2001     * not be {@code null}

2006     * idempotent and deterministic.
2007     *

2009     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.

2013    @OverridingEncouraged

2158     * rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and
2159     * only if {@code payloadWildcardType} models a Java {@linkplain
2160     * java.lang.reflect.WildcardType wildcard type} and not any other
2161     * type, and if and only if {@code receiverClass} models a
2162     * {@linkplain Class Java class} and not any other type.
2163     *
2164     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
2165     * method.</p>
2166     *
2167     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
2168     *
2169     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
2170     * receiverClass}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
2171     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
2172     *
2173     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadWildcardType};
2174     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
2175     *
2176     * @param receiverClass the receiver type as described above; must
2177     * not be {@code null}
2178     *
2179     * @param payloadWildcardType the payload type as described above; must
2180     * not be {@code null}
2181     *
2182     * @param lowerBounded whether {@code payloadWildcardType} is a
2183     * lower-bounded wildcard type
2184     *
2185     * @return {@code false} in all cases
2186     *
2187     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
2188     * idempotent and deterministic.
2189     *
2190     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
2191     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
2192     *
2193     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
2194     */

2197      return false;
2198    }
2199
2200    private final <X, Y> boolean parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromType(final Type<X> receiverParameterizedType, final Type<Y> payloadType) {
2201      if (payloadType.hasTypeArguments()) {
2202        return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
2203      } else if (payloadType.componentType() == null) {
2204        if (payloadType.lowerBounded()) {
2205          return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType, true);
2206        } else if (payloadType.upperBounded()) {
2207          if (payloadType.named()) {
2208            return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
2209          } else {
2210            return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType, false);
2211          }
2212        } else {
2213          return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
2214        }
2215      } else if (payloadType.type() == payloadType) {
2216        return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
2217      } else {
2218        return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
2219      }
2220    }
2221

2462    private final <X, Y> boolean genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverGenericArrayType,
2463                                                                                      final Type<Y> payloadNonParameterizedType) {
2464      if (payloadNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
2465        if (payloadNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
2466          return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType, true);
2467        } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
2468          if (payloadNonParameterizedType.named()) {
2469            return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2470          } else {
2471            return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType, false);
2472          }
2473        } else {
2474          return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2475        }
2476      } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.type() == payloadNonParameterizedType) {
2477        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2478      } else {
2479        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2480      }
2481    }

2528    /**

2531     * is assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the
2532     * supplied {@code receiverGenericArrayType}, according to the
2533     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance,
2534     * and if and only if {@code payloadParameterizedType} models a

2536     * parameterized type} and not any other type, and if and only if
